text.*:
Loeb House
General information
Town or city Cambridge, Massachusetts
Country United States
Completed 1940
Owner Harvard University
Design and construction
Architect McKim, Mead & White

The Loeb House is a building at the Harvard Business School on the campus of Harvard University in Cambridge, Massachusetts, U.S.. Its construction was supported with a donation from John Langeloth Loeb Sr., and it was completed in 1940.[1] It was designed in the Georgian Revival architectural style by McKim, Mead & White.[1]

References[edit]

  1. ^ a b "Loeb House". Harvard Business School. Retrieved October 15, 2017.
